title: vdemlite
text: vdemlite provides lightweight version Varieties Democracy (V-Dem) dataset incorporates many core measures V-Dem contemporary period easy work R. package provides functions downloading loading data, well exploring data searching particular indicators. package addresses two challenges arise using full dataset. First, can readily used cloud production environments like Posit Cloud shinyapps.io without purchase additional computing resources. Second, provides user-friendly functions arguments makes easier download, filter, explore data R. goal make dataset accessible new users may completely developed wrangling workflow convenient advanced users frequently use V-Dem contemporary analysis.

title: vdemlite
text: vdemlite incorporates data 297 variables V-Dem indices indicators 1970 present organized around structure aggregation outlined document Appendix V-Dem Codebook. three primary functions vdemlite package: - fetchdem() provides functionality downloading V-Dem data included vdemlite loads R. - summarizedem() provides interactive table summary statistics data , smaller queries, capacity visualization. - searchdem() function returns interactive, searchable table dataset. can install latest version vdemlite GitHub using pak package: Alternatively, use remotes package devtools package:

title: vdemlite
text: main function vdemlite fetchdem(), can used query vdemlite dataset retrieve data specific indicators, groups indicators, years, countries. function returns data frame requested data. Simply calling fetchdem() return entire vdemlite dataset. fetchdem() takes five arguments allow user conduct targeted queries: indicators, start_year, end_year, countries, wide. indicators argument character vector V-Dem indicator codes also groups variables “big_5” (five main high-level democracy indexes) “v2x_libdem_all” (indices indicators used construction liberal democracy index. start_year end_year arguments specify range years fetch data . countries argument character vector three-digit iso3c country codes. wide argument specifies whether return data wide format (default) long format.
code: fetchdem(indicators = NULL,            start_year = 1970,            end_year = 2023,           countries = NULL,           wide = TRUE)

title: vdemlite
text: Let’s say wanted get Polyarchy score countries years 1980-2020. setting indicators v2x_polyarchy start_year end_year 1980 2020, respectively. can add indicators desired list filter specific countries using combine function (c()). example, wanted get polyarchy clean elections index USA Sweden, set indicators c("v2x_polyarchy", "v2xel_frefair") countries c("USA", "SWE"). default, fetchdem() returns data wide format. However, can also return data long format setting wide argument FALSE.
code: library(vdemlite)  # Polyarchy score for all countries for 1980-2020 polyarchy <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_polyarchy",                        start_year = 1980, end_year = 2020) # Polyarchy and clean elections index for USA and Sweden for 2000-2020 my_indicators <- fetchdem(indicators = c("v2x_polyarchy", "v2xel_frefair"),                            countries = c("USA", "SWE")) # Five main high-level indices for all countries and years in long format big_5 <- fetchdem(indicators = c("v2x_polyarchy", "v2xel_frefair"),                    countries = c("USA", "SWE"), wide = FALSE)

title: vdemlite
text: fetchdem() can also used retrieve groups indexes indicators follow structure aggregation outlined Appendix V-Dem Codebook. Setting indicators big_5 retrieve five main high-level indices countries years. also groupings available high-level, mid-level, lower-level indices. example, get high-level indices countries 2015 like : Similarly, low-level mid-level indices specify indicators = "low_level" indicators = "mid_level". One useful bit information leveraging functionality V-Dem, indexes start prefix v2x_. vdemlite leverages structure enable user retrieve indices indicators used construction particular index. Specifically, can retrieve indices indicators used construction particular index code adding suffix _all index code. example, get indicators comprise liberal democracy index India, set indicators v2x_libdem_all countries IND. Similarly, can get indicators comprise Regimes World index Venezuela setting indicators v2x_regime_all countries VEN. additional categories included construction indicators also included vdemlite including legitimation, civic_space, mass_mobilization, citizen_engagement, academic_space background (background factors). Let’s grab background factors polyarchy index countries 2015 use analysis.
code: # Five main high-level indices for all countries and years in long format big_5 <- fetchdem(indicators = "big_5", wide = FALSE) # All high-level indices for all countries in 2015 high_level_2015 <- fetchdem(indicators = "high_level",                         start_year = 2015, end_year = 2015) # Indicators that comprise the liberal democracy index for India, all years lib_dem_ind_2010 <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_libdem_all",                             countries = "IND") # Indicators that comprise the Regimes of the World index for Venezuela, all years regime_venezuela <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_regime_all",                            countries = "VEN") # Polyarchy and background factors, all countries and years polyarchy_analysis <- fetchdem(indicators = c("v2x_polyarchy", "background"),                                 start_year = 2015, end_year = 2015)  # Run a regression model1 <- lm(v2x_polyarchy ~ log(e_gdppc) +                 e_pechmor +                 e_pelifeex +                 log(e_wb_pop),               data = polyarchy_analysis)  # Display the results summary(model1) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = v2x_polyarchy ~ log(e_gdppc) + e_pechmor + e_pelifeex +  #>     log(e_wb_pop), data = polyarchy_analysis) #>  #> Residuals: #>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max  #> -0.60413 -0.17328  0.05856  0.17371  0.41818  #>  #> Coefficients: #>                Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)   -0.502659   0.371600  -1.353 0.177994     #> log(e_gdppc)   0.022868   0.026088   0.877 0.381996     #> e_pechmor      0.001414   0.001063   1.330 0.185317     #> e_pelifeex     0.018181   0.004987   3.646 0.000356 *** #> log(e_wb_pop) -0.022915   0.010431  -2.197 0.029412 *   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 0.2245 on 166 degrees of freedom #>   (8 observations deleted due to missingness) #> Multiple R-squared:  0.2581, Adjusted R-squared:  0.2403  #> F-statistic: 14.44 on 4 and 166 DF,  p-value: 3.871e-10

title: vdemlite
text: Sometimes might curious know coverage given index indicator get quick look data look individual countries. , vdemlite includes function called summarizedem() provides interactive, table summary statistics given index indicator: summarizedem() takes four arguments: indicator, start_year, end_year countries. indicator argument takes character string representing exactly one V-Dem indicator code. start_year end_year arguments specify range years fetch data , countries argument character vector country codes. Let’s say wanted get summary polyarchy index countries years: maybe want summary polyarchy index USA Sweden years 2000-2020:
code: summarizedem(indicator = NULL,               start_year = 1970,               end_year = 2023,               countries = NULL) # Summary statistics for the polyarchy index summarizedem(indicator = "v2x_polyarchy") # Summary statistics for the polyarchy index for the USA and Sweden for 2000-2020 summarizedem(indicator = "v2x_polyarchy",               start_year = 2000, end_year = 2020,               countries = c("USA", "SWE"))

title: vdemlite
text: wondering whether favorite V-Dem indicator available, vdemlite includes function called searchdem() , default, produces searchable table V-Dem indicators included dataset. table based Structure V-Dem Indices, Components Indicators document includes four columns: variable tag; index indicator descriptor; level index indicator (high-level index, mid-level index, lower-level index; indicator); column called “Part” distinguishes V-Dem Indicators Indices (part 1) indices created using V-Dem data (part 2). default behavior return indices descriptions. character vector indices provided, function return sub-indices indicators used construct selected indices. Note list indicators associated given index corresponds set indicators fetchdem() function retrieve _all suffix, e.g. fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_libdem_all"). possible specify groups indicators can used fetchdem() function, e.g. big5, v2x_libdem_all, etc. indices argument. However, can search “level” groupings (e.g. high_level, mid_level lower_level) table .
code: # Produce a searchable table of the indicators  searchdem() searchdem("v2x_libdem")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Emmanuel Teitelbaum. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Teitelbaum E (2024). vdemlite: Lightwight Tool Querying V-Dem Data. R package version 0.0.3.9000, https://eteitelbaum.github.io/vdemlite/, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/-sa/4.0/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vdemlite: A Lightwight Tool for Querying V-Dem Data},   author = {Emmanuel Teitelbaum},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.3.9000, https://eteitelbaum.github.io/vdemlite/},   url = {https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/}, }

what: A Lightwight Tool for Querying V-Dem Data
title: A Lightwight Tool for Querying V-Dem Data
text: vdemlite provides lightweight version Varieties Democracy (V-Dem) dataset incorporates many core measures V-Dem contemporary period easy work R. package provides functions downloading loading data, well exploring data searching particular indicators. vdemlite addresses two challenges arise using full dataset. First, can readily used cloud production environments like Posit Cloud shinyapps.io without purchase additional computing resources. Second, provides user-friendly functions arguments makes easier download, filter, explore data R. goal make dataset accessible new users may completely developed wrangling workflow convenient advanced users frequently use V-Dem contemporary analysis. indicators included vdemlite taken Structure V-Dem Indices, Components Indicators document turn drawn Appendix V-Dem codebook.

title: A Lightwight Tool for Querying V-Dem Data
text: can install development version vdemlite GitHub :

title: A Lightwight Tool for Querying V-Dem Data
text: vdemlite three functions: fetchdem(), summarizedem(), searchdem(). fetchdem() main function downloads V-Dem data loads R. Within fetchdem(), can specify one V-Dem indexes indicators along years countries interested . function download data return tibble specified indexes indicators. can retrieve data multiple indicators countries using combine function c(). fetchdem also includes functionality retrieving groups indicators relate structure aggregation V-Dem dataset. See documentation details. want quick summary indicator set indicators, summarizedem() provide searchable HTML table summary statistics well info missing data (grouped country) specified indicators. Finally, can use searchdem find specific indicators indicators used construct index. example, can use searchdem("civil liberties" find indicators used construct civil liberties index. searchdem() without arguments produces searchable HTML table indicators dataset.
code: library(vdemlite)  # Grab the polyarchy scores for the United States between 2000 and 2020 my_indicators <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_polyarchy",                          start_year = 2000, end_year = 2020,                          countries = "USA")

what: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
title: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
text: function filters data slimmed version V-Dem dataset based specified indicators, years, countries. can return data either wide long format. Users can query specific indices indicators well pre-defined groups indicators defined V-Dem codebook.

title: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
code: fetchdem(   indicators = NULL,   start_year = 1970,   end_year = 2023,   countries = NULL,   wide = TRUE )

title: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
text: indicators character vector indicator names categories. NULL, indicators included. start_year starting year filtering data. Default 1970. end_year ending year filtering data. Default 2023. countries character vector country IDs filter data. NULL, countries included. wide Logical, whether return data wide format. FALSE, returns data long format. Default TRUE.

title: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
text: data frame containing filtered V-Dem Lite data specified format.

title: Fetch and Filter V-Dem Lite Data — fetchdem
code: # Polyarchy score for all countries for 1980-2020 polyarchy <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_polyarchy",                       start_year = 1980, end_year = 2020)  # Polyarchy and clean elections index for USA and Sweden for 2000-2020 my_indicators <- fetchdem(indicators = c("v2x_polyarchy", "v2xel_frefair"),                         start_year = 2000, end_year = 2020,                         countries = c("USA", "SWE"))  # Five main high-level indices for all countries and years in long format big_5 <- fetchdem(indicators = "big_5", wide = FALSE)  # Indicators that comprise the liberal democracy index for India, all years lib_dem_ind_2010 <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_libdem_all",                             countries = "IND")  # Indicators that comprise the Regimes of the World index for Venezuela, all years regime_venezuela <- fetchdem(indicators = "v2x_regime_all",                            countries = "VEN")  # All high-level indices for all countries in 2015 high_level_2015 <- fetchdem(indicators = "high_level",                         start_year = 2015, end_year = 2015)  # All mid-level indices for all countries in 2015 mid_level_2015 <- fetchdem(indicators = "mid_level",                          start_year = 2015, end_year = 2015)  # All lower-level indices for all countries in 2015 lower_level_2015 <- fetchdem(indicators = "lower_level",                         start_year = 2015, end_year = 2015)  # Polyarchy and background factors, all countries and years polyarchy_analysis <- fetchdem(indicators = c("v2x_polyarchy", "background"))

what: Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem
title: Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem
text: function provides searchable table tags names V-Dem indices included vdemlite. table based Structure V-Dem Indices, Components Indicators document includes four columns: variable tag; index indicator descriptor; level index indicator (high-level index, mid-level index, lower-level index; indicator); column called "Part" distinguishes V-Dem Indicators Indices (part 1) indices created using V-Dem data (part 2). default behavior return indices descriptions. character vector indices provided, function return sub-indices indicators used construct selected indices.

title: Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem
Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem
text: indices character vector indices search expand. Useful looking sub-indices indicators used construct high-level index. Default NULL.

title: Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem
text: interactive table names descriptions V-Dem indicators indices included vdemlite dataset.

title: Search and Expand Tags Based on Indices — searchdem

what: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
title: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
text: function summarizes specified V-Dem indicator country given time period.

title: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
code: summarizedem(   indicator = NULL,   start_year = 1970,   end_year = 2023,   countries = NULL )

title: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
text: indicator character string specifying V-Dem indicator summarize. start_year integer specifying start year summary (default 1970). end_year integer specifying end year summary (default 2023). countries optional character vector specifying countries include (default NULL, includes countries).

title: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
text: table summarizing specified indicator country.

title: Summarize V-Dem Data by Country — summarizedem
The V-Dem Lite Dataset — vdemlite
text: subset Varieties Democracy (V-Dem) dataset incorporates data 297 V-Dem indices indicators 1970 present. dataset incorporates indices indicators listed Appendix V-Dem Codebook.

title: The V-Dem Lite Dataset — vdemlite
The V-Dem Lite Dataset — vdemlite
text: data frame 297 variables 9170 observations.

title: The V-Dem Lite Dataset — vdemlite
text: <https://www.v-dem.net/data/-v-dem-dataset/

title: The V-Dem Lite Dataset — vdemlite
